The UNFPA attributed South Korea’s success not to the ban but to changes in culture based on the “Love Your Daughters” media campaign. Woojin Chung and Monica Das Gupta questioned explanations that looked to “culture” generally and that ignored changes in the South Korean agricultural economy. Woojin Chung and Monica Das Gupta, “The Decline of Sex Preference in South Korea: The Roles of Development and Public Policy
As argued by Uma Narayan, feminist campaigns against harmful cultural practices can stereotype women in the global South as “dupes of patriarchy
